entity.name: `loading="lazy"`
entity.description: Load certain resources only when needed.
entity.descriptionClean: Load certain resources only when needed.

mdn.title: Lazy loading
mdn.summary: Lazy loading is a strategy to identify resources as non-blocking (non-critical) and load these only when needed. It's a way to shorten the length of the critical rendering path, which translates into reduced page load times.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="picture.jpg" loading="lazy" /> <iframe src="supplementary.html" loading="lazy"></iframe>

resources.title: Browser-level image lazy loading for the web

webFeature.description_html: The loading="lazy" attribute for <img> and <iframe> elements blocks loading the external resource until the user scrolls to that element's part of the page.
webFeature.name: Lazy-loading images and iframes

entity.name: `srcset` and `sizes` attributes
entity.description: Attributes that allow providing several source images with hints to help the browser pick the right one.
entity.descriptionClean: Attributes that allow providing several source images with hints to help the browser pick the right one.

mdn.title: : The Image Embed element
mdn.summary: The HTML element embeds an image into the document.

example.codeHighlighted: <img srcset="fairy-med.jpg 480w, fairy-large.jpg 800w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 480px, 800px" src="fairy-large.jpg" alt="Elva dressed as a fairy" />

webFeature.description_html: The imagesrcset and imagesizes attributes with the rel="preload" attribute for the <link> HTML element starts fetching responsive images before they're found in the body of the document.
webFeature.name: Preloading responsive images

entity.name: Resource Hints
entity.description:
Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance.
Syntax: `<link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">`.
entity.descriptionClean: Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance.Syntax: <link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">.
entity.descriptionHtml: Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance. Syntax: <link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">.

mdn.title: Web performance resources
mdn.summary:
There are many reasons why your website should perform as well as possible.
Below is a quick review of best practices, tools, APIs with links to provide more information about each topic.

example.codeHighlighted: <link rel="preload" href="picture.jpg" /> <link rel="dns-prefetch" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/" />

resources.title: Understanding CSS preload and other resource hints - LogRocket Blog

entity.name: Content-Security Policy (CSP)
entity.description: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.
entity.descriptionClean: A set of directives from a website to a browser, that helps to detect and mitigate XSS attacks.

mdn.title: Content Security Policy (CSP)
mdn.summary: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a feature that helps to prevent or minimize the risk of certain types of security threats. It consists of a series of instructions from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to place restrictions on the things that the code comprising the site is allowed to do.

webFeature.description_html: Content Security Policy (CSP) helps to mitigate certain security threats, including cross-site scripting (XSS) and clickjacking attacks. It consists of a set of directives from a website to a browser, which instruct the browser to restrict the things that the site is allowed to do.
webFeature.name: Content Security Policy (CSP)

entity.name: `fetchpriority` attribute
entity.description: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.

mdn.title: HTMLImageElement: fetchPriority property
mdn.summary: The fetchPriority property of the HTMLImageElement interface represents a hint to the browser indicating how it should prioritize fetching a particular image relative to other images. It reflects the fetchpriority attribute of the corresponding element.

resources.title: Priority Hints API · Issue #704 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub
Optimizing resource loading with the Fetch Priority API

webFeature.description_html: The fetch() priority option and the fetchpriority HTML attribute give hints to the browser about which requests to do before other requests of the same type.
webFeature.name: Fetch priority

entity.name: `blocking="render"`
entity.description: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on `<link>`, `<script>` and `<style>`.
entity.descriptionClean: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.
entity.descriptionHtml: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.

mdn.title: <script>: The Script element
mdn.summary: The <script> HTML element is used to embed executable code or data; this is typically used to embed or refer to JavaScript code. The <script> element can also be used with other languages, such as WebGL's GLSL shader programming language and JSON.

example.codeHighlighted: <script blocking="render" async src="async-script.js"></script>

resources.title: Review request on `blocking=render` attribute for scripts and stylesheets · Issue #727 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM.
webFeature.name: blocking="render"

entity.name: `<model>` (Inline AR/VR/3D content)
entity.description: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows embedding 3D models in HTML with built-in controls.

resources.title: AR, VR, and a Model for 3D in HTML | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Safari Technology Preview 137 Release Notes | Apple Developer Documentation

entity.name: `controlslist` attribute
entity.description: Prevent certain controls from appearing in the toolbar of a media element.
entity.descriptionClean: Prevent certain controls from appearing in the toolbar of a media element.

mdn.title: HTMLMediaElement: controlsList property
mdn.summary:
The controlsList property of the
HTMLMediaElement interface returns a DOMTokenList that helps the user
agent select what controls to show on the media element whenever the user agent shows
its own set of controls. The DOMTokenList takes one or more of three possible values:
nodownload, nofullscreen, and noremoteplayback.

webFeature.description_html: The controlslist attribute for <audio> or <video> hides parts of the browser's built-in controls. For example, controlslist="nofullscreen" removes the button to play the video in fullscreen.
webFeature.name: controlslist

entity.name: CSS Custom Highlight API
entity.description: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.

mdn.title: CSS Custom Highlight API
mdn.summary: The CSS Custom Highlight API provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.

example.codeHighlighted: // css ::highlight(my-custom-highlight) { background-color: blue; } // js const parentNode = document.getElementById("foo"); const range1 = new Range(); range1.setStart(parentNode, 10); range1.setEnd(parentNode, 20); const highlight = new Highlight(range1); CSS.highlights.set("my-custom-highlight", highlight);

webFeature.description_html: Custom highlights style arbitrary text ranges, without adding extra elements to the DOM.
webFeature.name: Custom highlights

entity.name: `setHtmlUnsafe()`
entity.description: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.
entity.descriptionClean: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.
entity.descriptionHtml: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.

mdn.title: Element: setHTMLUnsafe() method
mdn.summary: The setHTMLUnsafe() method of the Element interface is used to parse HTML input into a DocumentFragment, optionally filtering out unwanted elements and attributes, and those that don't belong in the context, and then using it to replace the element's subtree in the DOM.

example.code:
const value = "

This is a string of text

"; document.getElementById("target").setHTMLUnsafe(value);
example.codeHighlighted: const value = "<p>This is a string of text</p>"; document.getElementById("target").setHTMLUnsafe(value);

webFeature.description_html: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
webFeature.name: Unsanitized HTML parsing methods

entity.name: `parseHtmlUnsafe()`
entity.description: Used to parse a string of HTML, which may contain declarative shadow roots, in order to create a new Document instance.
entity.descriptionClean: Used to parse a string of HTML, which may contain declarative shadow roots, in order to create a new Document instance.

mdn.title: Document: parseHTMLUnsafe() static method
mdn.summary: The parseHTMLUnsafe() static method of the Document object is used to parse HTML input, optionally filtering unwanted HTML elements and attributes, in order to create a new Document instance.

entity.name: `Intl.Segmenter` API
entity.description: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.
entity.descriptionClean: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.

mdn.title: Intl.Segmenter
mdn.summary: The Intl.Segmenter object enables locale-sensitive text segmentation, enabling you to get meaningful items (graphemes, words or sentences) from a string.

example.codeHighlighted: const segmenterFr = new Intl.Segmenter("fr", { granularity: "word" }); const string1 = "Que ma joie demeure"; const iterator1 = segmenterFr.segment(string1)[Symbol.iterator](); console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: 'Que' console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: ' '

webFeature.description_html: The Intl.Segmenter API creates a locale-aware text splitter that can separate a string into meaningful graphemes, words, or sentences.
webFeature.name: Intl.Segmenter
